dcterms:creator: R. Kalman
dcterms:description: The Kalman filter is a mathematical method used for estimating the state of a dynamic system from a series of incomplete and noisy measurements. It is optimal for linear systems with Gaussian noise.
dcterms:title: Kalman Filter

dcterms:creator: I. C. Schick
S. K. Mitter
dcterms:description: The Huber Contamination Model is a statistical model that allows for robust estimation in the presence of heavy-tailed observation noise, providing guarantees for linear quadratic estimation.
dcterms:title: Huber Contamination Model

dcterms:creator: M. Roth
E. Özkan
F. Gustafsson
dcterms:description: A Student's t filter is designed for scenarios where the process and measurement noise are heavy-tailed, providing robustness against outliers in the data.
dcterms:title: Student's t Filter

dcterms:creator: H. Poor
dcterms:description: The Robust Wiener Filter is an adaptation of the Wiener filter that provides robustness against outliers and non-Gaussian noise in the observations.
dcterms:title: Robust Wiener Filter

dcterms:creator: I. Diakonikolas
D. M. Kane
A. Stewart
dcterms:description: Robust Linear Regression is a statistical method that aims to provide accurate estimates of the relationship between variables in the presence of outliers.
dcterms:title: Robust Linear Regression

dcterms:creator: W. Zhang
M. Zhu
K. G. Derpanis
dcterms:description: The Penn Action Dataset is a large dataset containing video clips with detailed action annotations, used for action recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: Penn Action Dataset

dcterms:creator: H. Jhuang
J. Gall
S. Zufﬁ
C. Schmid
M. J. Black
dcterms:description: The Sub-JHMDB Dataset is a subset of the JHMDB dataset, focusing on action recognition with annotated video clips.
dcterms:title: Sub-JHMDB Dataset
